intro: Cyrtandra stupantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian waterwheel plant, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the island of Hawaii and is characterized by its distinctive whorled leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as stream banks and marshes. Its leaves are often submerged or floating, adapted to its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat. Cyrtandra stupantha plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
